title: Onboarding + literature review
description: Joined VIP Team 1270 and did early reading on smart city sensing + infrastructure monitoring. Defined a first pass at what 'smart cities' meant for our subteam focus.

title: Data pipeline + sensor alignment (early)
description: Worked on organizing data sources and thinking through how multi-source data would line up over time + location (GPS + sensor logs conceptually).

title: Equity / inclusivity pivot
description: Expanded from 'infrastructure condition' into equity context: transit access, environmental exposure, and neighborhood-level comparisons.

title: Field test framing + validation plan
description: Outlined what validation should look like (ground truth comparison, error sources, and what counts as a correct detection).

title: Phase 1 write-up
description: Summarized early progress and consolidated baseline findings into a report-style format for the semester deliverable.

title: Python workflow + metric definitions
description: Defined the metrics we cared about (infrastructure indicators + equity indicators) and how they would be computed from datasets.

title: Neighborhood change / displacement framing
description: Reviewed approaches used in displacement / gentrification literature and documented what would be reasonable vs misleading to predict.

title: Urban heat + canopy research synthesis
description: Studied heat exposure patterns and documented how remote sensing + canopy metrics could be communicated responsibly.

title: Visualization prototype planning
description: Sketched what an interactive dashboard should show (layers, comparisons, and what a user should take away).

title: Presentation / wrap-up (Spring)
description: Packaged spring work into a shareable narrative and identified what was missing for a complete end-to-end demo.

title: Integration push (Fall)
description: Focused on connecting datasets + outputs so results could be shown consistently (not scattered across docs).

title: Forecast concept (2030 scenarios)
description: Outlined scenario-based forecasts (e.g., stagnation vs expansion) and documented assumptions + risks of over-claiming.

title: Portfolio site planning
description: Planned the structure of a public portfolio: timeline, report, sources, and results dashboard with evidence tracking.

title: Validation + final edits
description: Final pass: sanity-check claims, verify sources, and finalize deliverables for the semester.

title: Final delivery
description: Archived work into a final report + portfolio format so it can be shared publicly with recruiters.
